He turns a corner heading right for the bleed tables. GERRY ENTERS from the staging area.  He grabs a net shouting a warning. KLAGES TURNS grabbing a syringe.  The monkey rushes her - KLAGES STABS with the syringe.  The monkey leaps --

head_text.subj: IT RUNS RIGHT UP HER ARM AND RIGHT OVER HER HELMET --

text: -- Leaping on the Bleed Table -- dumping samples, knockin over the blood vials, screeching at cadavers -- Gerry lunges at it with the net just missing --

head_text.subj: THE STAGING ROOM DOOR SUDDENLY OPENS AGAIN --

text: Haines, the AIT Leader, looks in to check out the noise. The monkey instantly LEAPS on the man.
IT CHOMPS DOWN HARD crunching completely through the AIT Leader's hand.  Blood spews. JAXX charges hard with Johnson and Gerry.
Get a Medic in here! THE MONKEY ESCAPES through the staging room door.
As the Monkey enters; Johnson and Gerry right behind.
Door!! Daylight.  AIT VOLUNTEERS carrying boxed monkey samples t the Vans are in the way.  Gerry crashes into them.
The back door is open.  Daylight.  JOHNSON DIVES slamming the door shut... Too late.
Like a shark attracted to the sounds of playing and laughter, it zeros in on the Day Care Center.
Kids suddenly stop playing on the swing.  More look up from the sandbox.  A little boy giggles with delight.
Monkey!  Monkey!
Bounding toward them.  Three SPACE PEOPLE in spacesuits are chasing it.  With nets.
Get the children inside!  Run!  Get away!  Get away from it!
KIDS run away in all directions.  A TEACHER grabs two TODDLERS screaming at the others to run.
It heads right for it, scattering kids everywhere as it scurries about the bars hissing and screeching --
The monkey lands -- five feet away from a traumatized TWO YEAR OLD GIRL.  She sits crying.  Too frightened to run.
Please, no -- please --
Jamie sitting in the sandbox -- then Jason.

Raises to its full height -- four feet; big as a child. JAXX LUNGES landing in the sand between child and beast - her syringe in hand -- The Big Monk hisses -- and topples over dead... TO JAXX:  in shock herself.  She tries to comfort the frightened child, but holds back from touching her --
It's okay now.  Yes, yes, everything's alright -- it's okay -- The Day Care Teacher grabs the child up -- She glares dow at Jaxx with disdain.
Talk to Reporters outside Fairfax Hospital.  Reese runs the show playing down the day's events.
The Army harvested the monkey colony as a precaution with the CDC's cooperation -- C.J. shoots angry looks at Reese trying to keep his cool.
We have one worker who has close contact with the monkeys here in isolation but he hasn't been diagnosed with the virus yet --
I can assure you the virus has been contained and there is no further danger of exposure to the public --

Doors kick open from the lead white van. The SIX MAN AIR MEDICAL ISOLATOR TEAM jumps out carrying the Vickers Isolator stretcher double time.  MAJ. HAINES is visible inside.  His mangled hand bandaged and bloodstained.
The Team sets the stretcher onto a steel track protruding from a hatchway in the building wall.  The Lead Man opens the outer hatch and bangs on the inner one.
We are inside looking over the victim's feet.  The inner wall hatch opens.  The Team grabs both sides and shoves the isolator on the tracks -- THROUGH THE WALL AND INTO:

A maximum containment (BL4) intensive care hospital room. The isolator inserts inside another plastic chamber surrounding a hospital bed.  Bright lights reflect throug the plastic isolator walls. FIGURES IN BLUE SPACESUITS approach.  They insert their arms through glove ports into the isolator.  With precision, they drag Maj. Haines onto the hospital bed; then shove the stretcher out the hatch and close it. MAJ. HOSKINS, a female doctor, inspects the bandaged hand while other hands cut away the man's clothes.
Let's get some antivirals in him. Ribovirin -- 40cc's -- 60 Interferon -- DOCTORS hook I.V. bags of antivirals to the victim.  Maj. Hoskins injects Haines with a sedative to calm him down.
The Spacesuit Doctors all move in eerie slow motion.  The scene looks like a UFO Alien Abductee's nightmare.
A perfect fall day.  Crisp blue skies.  Last Autumn leaves.

head_text.subj: THE FACE OF JAMIE RUNS TOWARDS US IN SLOW MOTION

text: WIDEN FROM:  Peter ceremoniously places his blood on the electron microscope.  Tense, nervous.  This is it.
Jason blitzes with Blackhawk.  Karl pumps and throws --

head_text.subj: THE FOOTBALL SPIRALS THROUGH THE AIR --

text: Pumps his fist in triumph.  We follow him to the wall calendar where he marks a big red "X" through "E" day. Thanksgiving.  He made it. SUPER:  THANKSGIVING DAY, 0930 HRS.

JAMIE FAKES and cuts around Gerry.  Gerry leaps tipping the football -- RIGHT INTO JAMIE'S HANDS.  She runs. C.J. can't catch her.  She's too fast -- he's out of shape.  Jamie scores, throws an aerial and spikes the ball.
Nancy, with POPSY and MAMA, Gerry's parents, hoot and holler from the deck. Gumby, the Kinkajoo, turns one flip after another as it scampers to Jamie and jumps in her arms.
Peter exits jubilant, savoring the sun.  His WIFE, GAYLE and TWO YOUNG DAUGHTERS descend on him from the car in a massive group hug.
Gerry opens the front door.  It's Peter and his family.
Guess who's coming to dinner?
Hey -- everybody -- The guest of honor has arrived. Gerry leads Peter, Gayle and his family into the den wher the gang is watching football on TV. C.J. is up pumping Peter's hand, genuinely thrilled.
(quietly)
I'm clean.  No big "E" --

Then this bug's for you -- I mean "Bud" -- Pete cracks up.  Jamie brings a tray of beers and picks u empties.  Peter and C.J. clinks fresh cans and swig. FOLLOW JAMIE; she shakes each can on the way back to the kitchen.  Ah, a swallow.  She looks around and takes the swig.  Not bad.  Not good either.
Jaxx checks the turkey in the oven.
Fifteen minutes everybody! Gayle sticks her head in.  She theatrically wipes her forehead and lets out a big "WHEW."  Jaxx stops what she' doing and gives her a big hug.
The Gang reacts loudly to the football game off in the other part of the house.  Karl is alone in the room fixed on the exotic birds. Jaxx sticks her head in, then quietly enters.
Reminds me of the jungle.  Nice.
You don't have to feed them everyday.  Uh -- Pete's here.  Looks good.
(not over enthusiastic)
I heard.
So?  Well?  Aren't you glad I forced you out of retirement? He studies her as if trying to place her.
Maybe.  I'm just not so sure we dodged a bullet like Pete says.
Don't you ever shut down?  Relax? She leads Karl by the hand firmly toward the kitchen.
The Decon Team's nuking the monkey house right now.  It'll be the only spot on the planet where not one living thing exists --

Okay, fine, but we did not quarantine the monkey handlers and the other employees.  Any one of them could be viral bombs walking around out there somewhere waiting to go off. He gestures to the outside world.  Jaxx glares at him.
Oh -- Happy Thanksgiving --
Everybody's pitching in.  She squeezes Karl in between C.J., Gerry, Jason and his Grandfather at the stove.
Put this guy to work before he broods to death.
(to Karl)

Halftime -- As if to explain their actions.  Peter slips a baggie on each of Karl's hands and shoves them in a batter bowl. The guys are balling hush puppies and dropping them in th Sunbeam electric skillet.  Gerry throws a touchdown puppy to Peter who feigns a slam dunk into the skillet.
The Hushpuppy drops in the skillet and sizzles in oil.
A Heat-suited DECON TEAMER drops a handful of "para- formaldehyde" crystals into the skillet.  They sizzle.
The VIEW TRACKS ALONG 10 extension cords -- Each running the length of the "gray zone" -- one veers off into each room.
It's completely barren and spotless.  The cord connects u 8 Sunbeam skillets.  All set to "high."  Formaldehyde crystals fry -- PLUMES OF LETHAL GAS BILLOW UP --
More skillets billow gas.  Moths drop to the floor dead. Two Mice run from behind the monkey cages... and die.

head_text.subj: GAS FUMES ENGULF THE ROOM AND OBLITERATE THE VIEW
A STEAMING TURKEY FLOATING THROUGH THE AIR

text: Cooked to perfection.

Gerry parades the turkey through the house leading everyone into the dining room.  Peter sets his beer can down as he follows the crowd. JAMIE MOVES INTO FRAME:  She picks Peter's can up with some others.  It's not empty.  She takes a swig.  She feels someone watching in mid-chug.  She turns -- TO JASON; watching her in mock brotherly shock. Jamie comically CRUSHES the can in her hand indicating he can expect the same treatment if he snitches.  Jason laughs at her over-the-top-macho-girl act .
We hover like God above the table and feast.  Pure Americana.  Everyone joins hands around.  Heads bowed. Gerry's father says the blessing --
Let us pray -- We give thanks -- this day, for family and friends --
CHUCK REESE, his FAMILY and FRIENDS, gather round for their own celebration.  The Waiter and Waitress deliverin the food and dressed as Pilgrims.

GIRARD bows his head with his WIFE, FAMILY and GRANDCHILDREN around their table. PUSH IN CLOSE ON GIRARD:  head bowed, eyes closed.  Ever so slowly, a crimson stream of blood rolls from his nose and trickles onto his plate.  He looks down startled --
He's bleeding into his mashed potatoes.  A steady drip- drip-drip.  He grabs up his napkin, horrified.

A Redneck/Biker bar.  Dead animals decorate the walls. TINY DANCES to the jukebox with a fresh beer.  He blows the foam right at us in slow-motion -- -- spritzing the WHITE TRASH GIRL he's dancing and smooching on.  She licks the foam off his chin.  She steals his mug, dancing seductively, drinking his beer.
Watching the girl turn him on.  We see petechiae on his cheek.  His eyes red.  A trickle of blood rolls from his nose.  He wipes it off with the back of his hand unaware.

IN THE ISOLATION ROOM:  Deke, the Biker Monkey Handler, looks worse.  A NURSE, wearing full barrier scrubs, glove and mask, places another anti-viral I.V. bag on his stand A WOMEN EIS officer observes.  SIRENS squeal O.S.
Paramedics roll in LOC, the Vietnamese Monkey Handler. The poor man is curled up with severe abdominal pains.
Loc speaks in Vietnamese.  He's frightened.  A NURSE cleans vomit from his face.
He's running a fever.  Hundred and one -- nausea --
He doesn't speak English, great. The young DOCTOR on duty examines his distended lower abdomen.  Loc winces in pain --
Right lower quadrant pain, rebound tenderness -- where's that bloodwork? An orderly sticks his head in with chart --
This guy's white blood count's way up.  Acute shift to the left. Atypical lymphocytes -- Loc pleads in Vietnamese.  The young Doctor thinks hard -
Right.  Let's get his appendix out --
TIGHT ON SCALPEL:  The Doctor makes the incision in Loc's lower bloated abdomen.  BLOOD spews under pressure from the opening dousing the Doctor -- Ebola Blood.
Abrupt laughter as the Men smoke cigars and tell "war stories."  C.J. scoffs at Peter's small scar on his palm.
Check this out -- He rolls up his sleeve and plops his arm on the table.  A ugly jagged scar travels the length of his forearm.
Oh right -- a virus did that? Must've been King Kong's.

A machete did that.  This Bolivian Chief thought the vaccine I was trying to give him was poison -- Karl saved my cojones -- Laughter.  Karl chops the table like a machete.  C.J. grabs his groin.  Karl is actually enjoying himself.
I made a deal.  The Chief would let me shoot him with the syringe -- If -- He lets everybody hang for a second --
If I'd let him shoot me in the same spot with his blow gun.
Well -- where'd he shoot you? Karl shys.  C.J. cajoles.  Everybody eggs him on.  Karl stands up reluctantly undoing his trousers.

She cracks up with Gayle and Jamie.  Their laughter is suddenly broken by C.J.'s BEEPER.  The piercing sound has the effect of an air raid siren on the gathered. A momentary hush -- C.J. just stares at it beeping. The PHONE RINGS.  Jaxx grabs the cordless in the kitchen.
Jaxx's -- PUSH IN FAST:  Her horrified expression says it all. Outbreak.
A madhouse as C.J., Karl and Jaxx arrive.  Karl angers.
This is not good.  The virus could be walking outta here.  Where the hell is the CDC?  They should be here round the clock!
(showing her ID)
U.S. Army.  Which way to "isolation"? A harassed ORDERLY points down the "yellow" hall.
PATIENTS in a crush to sign themselves out argue with distraught ADMINISTRATORS at the desk.
I'm discharging myself.  I don't want to catch this thing -- A TV NEWS WOMEN hounds TWO SENIOR M.D.s who are "blown."
How many cases do you have?  Do you know the virus is spreading?
We haven't processed all the information yet.  The Health Department will make a statement -- Excuse us -- They hurry away.  A SECURITY GUARD blocks the News Crew.
A young EIS Officer talks nervously on a cellular phone - AS JOHNSON, JAXX AND C.J. BARGE in --
You've got a major panic outside Lieutenant.  Don't you think you should be out there taking charge? Jaxx and C.J. flash military I.D.  The Officer is spooked
I'm waiting for my superior officer.
Do you have an "index" case? (blank look from Lt.)
The person who spread the virus? Jaxx and C.J. continue right into the Isolation ward.
Hey -- you're not authorized -- (frazzled to Johnson)
This is only my second month in the field -- I'm --
(with sincere sympathy)
-- just not ready for this.  I know. It's not your fault.

Doors bang open.  C.J. pushes Deke, the monkey handler, i the Army isolator litter.  He looks bad. Karl and Jaxx wheel Loc right behind in his isolator.  He looks worse still recovering from surgery. REESE APPROACHES from the other end with EIS OFFICERS, tw ADMINISTRATORS and two SECURITY GUARDS.  A standoff.
Well, I'm not surprised to see you here, Karl.  You move fast.
(controlling his anger)
Got to stay ahead of the pack.
(intervening)

Chuck, I'm using my authority to move these patients to the Slammer. We're better equipped.  You've got your hands full here. Reese bristles.  His authority challenged in front of his own people.  He checks Loc's chart.

E.R. opened him up for a crash appendectomy.  His peritoneal cavity was full of blood.  When they ran a check on him, they found out he worked at Synergy.  One O.R.'s contaminated -- so is the hospital lab.  A Doctor and two Nurses were exposed --
(letting go)
You should've quarantined them! Karl and Reese; face to face --
I'm quarantining the hospital. (to his officers)

Contain these people and these patients -- unless they're out of the building before I make the order official -- Jaxx, Karl and C.J. eye each other amazed.  Reese has intentionally given them a chance to leave and save face.
Jaxx leads Karl and C.J. with their patients to a side exit avoiding the panic.
C'mon.  This way --

Chaos.  TV CREWS are visible camped outside the entrance. POLICE have arrived.  Inside, PEOPLE besiege the staff fo attention. JAXX SEES GIRARD being wheeled in looking deathly pale. REESE spots him from across the room.  Their eyes meet.
Isolate that man immediately!
Backs to the ramp as Jaxx, Karl and C.J. roll out with th patients. The AIT TEAM jumps out and load the isolators.
A CROWD has gathered.  Police run yellow tape across the entrance.  TV Crews throw lights on the eerie scene.
POLICE SET UP BARRICADES right behind them.
An Ambulance blows by going the other way.  Peter anxiously searches the radio for news.  The Kids pinch an tease each other in the backseat adding to the racket.
(tense and worried)
We're almost home.  You're making your father nervous --
Wound up, scanning the radio for News.  Sweat beads break on his forehead.  He pushes his glasses up on his nose.
Traffic coming at them SUDDENLY BLURS -- then clears -- Gayle watches him closely.  Peter doesn't let on.
He pulls up in the driveway.  The kids unload.  His wife gets out to follow -- Peter stays behind the wheel --
Gayle?  I'm going back to the lab. They might need me -- Gayle stops cold.  She doesn't like this.
Go on, kids.  Wash your hands. Pete?  Are you okay? She moves toward his window to kiss him goodbye.  He wave before she can get too close and backs out.
I won't be long.  Promise -- PUSH IN CLOSE:  Gayle knows something is wrong.  Please, God, no.  She wipes her brief tears so the kids won't see
Petechiae begins to pop out on his face.  His tear dusts bleed red.  He sweats feverish.  He fights to see the roa -- It's got him.  The bug is eating him --
The Guard waves him through.  His vision blurs in and out
Peter covers his mouth and waving people away.
Dr. Jahrling -- are you okay?
Jahrling.  He flops on the chair beside the isolator, sticks a thermometer in his mouth, ties off his arm and draws his own blood. MAJ. HOSKINS enters in the blue spacesuit and takes over.

The place is jumping.  Phones ring.  Staff shout over the din.  TV monitors show News coverage on the "outbreak." MONITOR #1:  A NEWS ANCHOR stands before a world map tracing the path of the virus to the U.S.  Africa via the Philippines.

The monkey's voyage brought them by plane from the Philippines, to Amsterdam to JFK's animal unit and finally to Virginia -- carrying deadly virus.  How the monkeys contracted the African Ebola virus, the Army and the CDC can only speculate... Please call this number if you have any of the symptoms --
MONITOR #2:  CNN coverage from the mob scene at Fairfax Hospital.  A FEMALE ANCHOR grills the young EIS Officer.
We have five confirmed cases so far -- including three medical staff.
What are their chances for survival? No answer.  Awkward silence. TO C.J.:  on his headset telephone barking orders --

I want Virginia Health Departments, Maryland and D.C. to get every patient in a fifty mile radius to be transferred here to RIID -- And all blood samples sent to us for immediate testing.  You heard me! A STAFFER yells from the bank of phones.
We've got a case reported in D.C. C.J. sticks a pin on the map right in the capital.  He locks eyes with General Russell.  "Holy shit."
AIT's shove Loc, the second Monkey Handler, through the hatch into the Slammer.
Shocked to see PETER; his face peppered with hemorrhages.
Aw, Pete... I don't believe this is happening.
We could all be exposed -- Jaxx shivers at the thought.  PETER RAISES UP in bed making eye contact with them.  Sadly, he mouths the words
(reading his lips)
He wants me to call his family. Tell them he won't be home for dinner... (she nods affirmative)
I copy, Pete.  Hang in there. Pete understands.  He gives her "thumbs up" and sags back
The fridge full of deadly viruses is visible through the glass.  Jaxx sadly hangs up the phone.  Karl is with her.
The Slammer's already full and this thing is just getting started. C'mon, don't just stand there.  Get mad!  Say, "I told you so."

That's not going to save lives.  We both know none of the antivirals we've got is going to pull these people through.  They'll be soup in a week.  We need a super immuno serum to even have a chance to save anyone.  We need a survivor.

Well let's get one!  If we can pull Pete or any one of these patients through, the immunities in one person can save four more with their antibody serum.  Then sixteen and -- She fixes on Pete's guinea pigs through the glass.

Pete's got guinea pigs here that are immune to Ebola, a Supermonkey who's beat it.  I'll bleed these animals dry and spin off some immuno plasma. She's on fire.  A heightened urgency to her every word --
You can't despeciate enough serum from those guinea pigs and mice to treat an epidemic!  We should've been stockpiling years ago.
Well, what the fuck would you do? Pete's dying in here -- !
(frustrated)
We need a "magic bullet." Jaxx instantly understands.  She actually smiles --
Jaxx pulls out 4 units from plasma storage and sets them on the bench reverently.
Sister Genevieve.  The last four units you brought back from Africa. "Gold-plated" Ebola-eater. Karl savors the container -- his long lost friend.
Let's give the last of Sister G. to Pete... There's a good chance the serum will give his immune system the boost he needs to beat the bug... We owe it to him. He wipes a stray tear from her cheek.
Do it.  Try it.  Try everything.  I wish I'd had ten of you in Africa and Panama -- Bolivia -- India -- Jaxx doesn't know how to react to the compliment --

But this epidemic will be hopelessly out of control if we can't get the viral bombs off the street who're out there exposing innocent people. Jaxx takes Sister G's plasma with grim resolve and heads down the corridor.  From the back, we see her shoulders shudder.  She's crying.
Jaxx gives Peter the best she has to offer; she hooks one of the last units of Sister Genevieve's convalescent Seru to his I.V.  He forces a smile from his isolator.
Hey, what flavor is that?  I ordered pistachio.
That stuff will rot your teeth. This is Sister "G."  Nothing but the best for you, Pete. Pete is at a loss for words.  Jaxx won't let him speak.

The Good Sister would've wanted you to have it.  Get well. She reaches in through the glove port and daubs the sweat on his face.  Hemorrhages have popped out all over. The intercom BUZZES breaking the moment.  More trouble. Peter turns away in tears.  As Jaxx leaves.  PAN UP TO: The last of Sister Genevieve drips slowly into Pete's body.

We've got every other handler and employee in quarantine -- but we can't find him; "Timothy Whippert." C.J., JAXX AND JOHNSON go over Tiny's personnel file with the exhausted young FEMALE EIS OFFICER.
This is that handler who dumped those hot cadavers on us --
Checkout his blood test. Johnson pours over the Titre chart in Tiny's file.
Three categories.  "Anti-Ebola," "Anti-Marburg," "Anti- Simian HF."  "O" appears in everything but "Anti-Ebola." It's got numbers.
Whoa.  High-titres.  Plus four, plus three, plus four -- Jesus he's crawling with Ebola anti-bodies. He's a bomb.
How long ago did he react?  Do we know?
EIS just found out he cut himself doing a necropsy on a hot cyno about two weeks ago.
If he's got symptoms, he is a walking lethal contagion, one.  And two, he's either dead, or almost dead by now -- or three -- He's immune -- Johnson turns to Jaxx -- She's almost afraid to say it.
Survivor -- Match in a haystack.  This is it -- the whole room ignites.
I made contact with his mother.  She said he'd gone to the mall to the movies.  Apparently, he's a 'Bruce Willis' die-hard fan.
Where?  What mall?  C'mon -- c'mon. She points to a spot on the map.  Karl is hyper-alarmed.
Epidemic scenario.  Worst case.  A viral bomb roaming densely populated areas is more dangerous than a "serial killer." Silence.  Then the room goes into action.
Let's bring him in.  And no Police!
Screeching to a halt in front of the Mall entrances. TROOPERS pilling out and taking up positions at the doors
Jammed with holiday MOVIEGOERS, SHOPPERS and CRUISERS.
"Look Who's Talking" on the screen.  WE HEAR:  BRUCE WILLIS cracking up the audience as the Baby. WE SEE:  TEENAGERS kissing passionately on the back row. Their tongues all over each other.
Aerosol droplets glisten like snow in projector light.
Scanning the crowd with an infrared night scope.  The COUGHING AMPLIFIES, LOUDER, LOUDER, in Jaxx's mind.  She finally covers her ears, it's so annoying.
Patrolling long "MOVIE" lines of PEOPLE spilling into the main Mall.  "BACK TO THE FUTURE 2," "LITTLE MERMAID,"
He checks his Xerox of Tiny's photo, looking, searching.

A virologist's nightmare.  Everywhere he looks he sees germs spreading.  Two TEENAGERS sharing puffs on the same cigarette. Countless runny noses.  People COUGHING -- A COUGH BLASTS in Karl's direction, he brushes his jacket off as if Tarantulas were crawling on him. A MAN AND WOMAN eat from the same popcorn box with their two CHILDREN.  One child eats stray kernels off the floor unobserved by his parents.  The other wipes her runny nos with her bare hand then sticks the same "wet" hand in the popcorn box.

FOUR FAST FOODERS eat with their hands.  All double dip their french fries in the ketchup after each bite. TO:  JAXX; Now on stakeout in the "food halls" area.  She makes eye-contact with Karl and "thumbs" to the door. TO POLICE:  Standing out like sore thumbs at the entrance They're wearing surgical gloves.  Several sport surgical masks.  They cause a stir stopping SHOPPERS to show them Tiny's picture for a reaction. TO JOHNSON:  He's steamed.  Cops.  He mimes putting on surgical gloves then blowing his brains out.  He looks back to Jaxx -- His adrenalin starts to pump --
The Man is nodding, absolutely sure, pointing to Tiny's photo.  He turns and points to the public eating area.

There's Tiny.  Sitting alone woofing down burgers in overalls and hunting shirt. JOHNSON WENDS through the tables, circling the big man. JAXX CLOSES on the opposite side talking on a hand radio. THE FEMALE EIS OFFICER reacts on her radio and signals to two other EIS OFFICERS through the crowd.  They close.

He can almost reach out and tap the big man's shoulder. TWO POLICE suddenly spot Tiny from the other side and hea right toward him through the tables. TINY spots them, bolts up and heads into the crowd -- JOHNSON hurries after him pushing through people.
Tiny is now running bulling his way through the crowd. The Police in hot pursuit.  Johnson runs trying to get between Tiny and the Police --
Stop right there!  Stop!  Freeze it!
He reaches inside his overalls as if to draw a gun --
Clear!  Get outta the way! People hit the deck.  JOHNSON BULLS PAST the Police -- JAXX FIGHTS her way through the fleeing crowd --
-- and turns struggling to pull his hand out --
Johnson is in his line of fire -- Suddenly JAXX ENTERS frame disarming the Cop with her self-defense wrist lock.

His blood could be more lethal than your gun -- Jerk -- stupid -- KARL GRABS TINY'S HAND and slams him into a merchant's cart of cheese and smoked sausages.  The Big Man goes dow taking the cart with him. JAXX AND POLICE rush up with the female EIS officer. The Big Man on the floor pulls a handful of stolen CD's from inside his overalls.  It's not Tiny.
Take'em.  Here.  That's all I got. I swear.  Jesus -- I peed in my pants. Karl pulls himself up frustrated -- angry.  Jaxx helps him --
Karl -- ?
Ah, I can get up by myself. (to Female EIS Officer)
Do your job, Lieutenant.  You're the epidemic police.  Check him out -- People part.  Jaxx leads Johnson away.  A Policeman slaps cuffs on the Big Man.
Are you on medication? The Big Man shakes "no" as they lead him away.
Have you been bitten or scratched by a wild animal? (another "no" and a laugh)
Have you experienced any unusual symptoms in the last 24 hours. Now the Big Man looks at his captors suspiciously; Police in surgical gloves.  Some with masks.
Hey -- what is this?  Y'all think I was ebb-ducted in a UFO, don't cha? The Crowd laughs.  The young EIS Officer is embarrassed.
Karl knocks on the door again.
Mrs. Whippert we just want to ask you some questions about your son. We're not the police. Jaxx starts to speak.  Then a frightened voice inside --
(through door)
I toll those other people who was here earlier where he was.
Mrs. Whippert, he's not at the movies -- so why don't you help us? They both eye the several racks of deer antlers nailed haphazardly on the porch posts.
I'm a sportsman too, M'am.  Fishing. Your son's a hunter I see -- Silence.  He looks to Jaxx.  They're warm, Jaxx adds a "mother's concern."

M'am, I know you're scared, but just understand, your son may be very sick.  As a mother myself, I know you really want to help him. A beat.  The door slowly opens.  Tiny's MOTHER peers out. Drink in one hand.  Cigarette in the other.  Frightened.
Well, he toll me not to say nothin' to nobody when he callt yesterday. He went a huntin'.  He's on up at his cabin... Jaxx and Karl trade glances.  "He's alive"!
C.J. hangs up the phone.
We got it!  Subject was still kicking as of yesterday -- He moves to the wall map.  Two DEPUTY AIDES join him.  He puts a pin in the map.

The cabin is about seventy-five miles up the Savage River from here. Get me topos and recons of this area down to the square foot -- Staff get on the phones. PUSH IN TIGHT ON THE MAP:  The pin is in the southeast corner of West Virginia.  Names like Black Rock Canyon, Big Run and Backbone Mountain appear --
TWO AIDES in spacesuits wheel Deke's covered body by.

The monkey handler's lifeless face frozen in horrible agony, skin disintegrating, disappears as gloved hands zi the body bag over him.  The body slides into the rack. The big submarine door closes.  Gloved hands crank it shut.
Karl is loading a field isolator into a Huey with an AIT Team.  Inflatable rubber rafts follow. A government vehicle drives right across the open field -- lights flashing.
The Driver stops.  Chuck Reese gets out and faces Karl in the flashing lights.  Johnson is hardly glad to see him.
We lost the first monkey handler. First Ebola victim on U.S. soil. Awkward silence.
Let me go with you. Karl squints at him suspiciously.

Karl, look, we've quarantined seventeen people this guy may have exposed.  I should have done it your way.  I... stayed behind in Africa all those years ago.  In a way, I guess I stayed behind ever since... Not this time.
Better to be at the epicenter doing something about it -- ?
Beats catching it in the Men's room at the Burger King -- Karl's piercing stare morphs to a grin.  He picks up one end of a field container, Reese the other.  He's going.
Jaxx passes the Post Clinic.  She slows looking in the waiting room window --

Tiny's Mother is there waiting to have her blood tested. A Vietnamese family (Loc's); a mother and four small children, a couple of Biker types -- the room is filled with potential exposures. In the corner, Jaxx sees the little Girl from the sandbox in the arms of her very frightened young Mother.
It hits her.  Her own home.  Her own family.  Nobody's safe.
She rushes in and answers the ringing phone.
(on phone)
Oh, Gerry.  I was just going to call you.  It's been so -- She pales.  Something's wrong.  She sits down hard --
(on phone)
Jamie?  Oh my God.  Hundred and three?  When did the bleeding start?
Gerry looks spooked.  Jason broods at the glass doors. Blackhawk whines knowing something is wrong.
(on phone)
Doctor Levin came over and gave her some antibiotics.  "A touch of the flu," he said, "A 24 hour virus."
(on phone)
Doctors always say that!  "It's the flu.  Comeback next week."
(on phone)
Nance, we have to assume it's Ebola. Jaxx is an emotional minefield on the other end.
(on phone)
I don't know.  Thanksgiving -- when Pete was here somehow.  We may all be incubating the goddamn thing --
Get out here quick -- She hangs up.  Her world crashing in.  She sobs.
Karl and Jaxx face each other.  Karl is shocked.  The Hue engine begins to whine.
If she's got it.  Jamie has about seven days to live.  I'll find an anti-serum that works if I have to squeeze it out of my own veins -- Karl embraces her holding her tight.
Go get your daughter, Colonel. JOHNSON AND JAXX - COPTER IN B.G. He salutes her and boards the Huey.  Rotors rev up.
C.J. leads Jaxx clear as the Huey lifts off and climbs banking toward the mountains in the distance.
Karl watches her getting smaller and smaller.
Gerry and their Family M.D., DR. LEVIN, tend Jamie who is burning up with fever.  Both wear surgical masks.  Gerry carefully draws her blood --
I can't treat her here, Gerry.  We have to move her to the hospital --
(wits end)
Don't you think I know that. Gerry watches his daughter suffering.  He finally agrees.
Make them understand she needs complete and total isolation. Suddenly the THUD of a helicopter approaches outside.
The THROBBING intensifies.  The animals go crazy.  Jason runs outside with Blackhawk.
A Rescue Copter lands on the hill up behind the house. JAXX CLIMBS OUT with 3 AIT's carrying an isolator stretcher. Jason has never been so glad to see anybody in his life.
All right, Mom!  Yes! She hugs him on the run trying to hold it together.
Popsy holds the door open as Jaxx and the Team enter.
Popsy -- are you and Mama okay? He nods weakly.  Mama sets food on the table --
Sorry, M'am.  We can't, but thank you. They follow Jaxx to Jamie's room.
Jaxx nearly breaks when she sees her daughter lying there so still -- as if she's dead. Gerry braces her up.  Jaxx buries her head for a moment i his shoulder.  Then --
Let's go for a ride, Princess. The Team gently slides Jamie into the stretcher.
(her voice faint, weak)
Mom -- all I did was sip some beer -- don't be mad -- Am I going to die? Gerry and Jaxx trade quietly desperate looks.
No way.  You have to win the Olympics.
They load Jamie into the Copter along with Jason.  Gerry has to coax his parents.
You have to come too.  You could have been exposed.  I can't leave you here -- Popsy and Mama look at each other in fear.  Then Popsy takes Mama's hand and helps her into the Copter.
The Huey lifts off right at us.
Flying upriver on Johnson's copter through a canyon twenty-five feet above the river.  Just like Africa --
He's transfixed on the rushing water glimmering in the dying sun.  SOUNDS OF AFRICA swell.  Going upriver again.
Sir -- front's moving in.  Snow expected.  Be dark soon.
(snapping from his trance)
We have to find that cabin tonight. How much longer --
Ten minutes to the hot zone -- Reese hands Johnson a cup of coffee.
This is a long shot, Karl.  Even by your standards.
So was Ebola ever crossing the Atlantic, remember? Reese nods Karl's kudos.  Karl pulls out Tiny's photo.

Pete's a long shot to survive.  So is everybody else that shows symptoms.  This guy was exposed weeks ago with the other handlers before everyone else -- He threw antibodies and was still alive two days ago -- after his partner checked into the morgue.  That's a good sign.  We'd be irresponsible not to go after him.

Well -- too bad you never found that lost tribe in Africa you used to lecture us about -- You know -- the ones who passed down immunities over the generations to just about every virus emerging. (half-joking)
You could be back home fishing right now -- and we'd have all the immuno anti-sera we need.

I tell you what -- I would kiss that tribe member's ass on the fifty yard line at the Super Bowl if they'd just walk out of the jungle right now. Johnson toasts his coffee to Reese's.  They laugh in much needed release.
Sir -- coming up on the zone --

The Pilot turns on floodlights as they rise up from the river up-up-up a steep rugged cliff wall -- There it is.  A small cabin on a cliff overlooking the river and mountains.  Tiny's funky green Van is parked beside it.  The van doors stand open.
Looks deserted.  Get in closer.
A Deer... hanging from a tree branch -- horribly dismembered and strewn about.  Entrails and Blood are splattered all over the Van and the cabin.
The guy's lost it.  Dementia. The DRUMS OF AFRICA beat louder in Karl's head.

location: COPTER HOVERING IN VIEW DRUMS CONTINUING

text: Suddenly an Assault rifle opens up on the Copter.  Tiny stumbles out the front door firing wildly.
His face is pocked with hemorrhages.  Blood is caked around his nose and mouth.
Leave me alone you fuckers!  I know why you come.  I'm dying right here -- right fucking here!!
As Tiny rakes the trees wildly -- hitting the Copter.
The Pilot dives down the canyon fighting the controls.

head_text.subj: JAMIE IS SHOVED THROUGH THE WALL INTO THE SLAMMER.

text: The isolator rockets toward us with a metallic crunch.
(freaked)
Mom?  Where are my Mom and Dad? Maj. Hoskins calms her through the isolator.

They're coming Jamie.  Let's get you comfortable. Hoskins and her Aide use the arm ports to take Jamie's vitals and hook her up to I.V.'s. NOTE:  since she's in the isolator, MDs wear masks gloves etc., not spacesuits. SCREAMS and RAVINGS suddenly echo O.S.  Hoskins slams the inner door to keep Jamie from hearing.

head_text.subj: FOLLOW HOSKINS THROUGH THE SLAMMER TO

text: Maj. Haines screams in dementia next to Peter. TWO AIDES in spacesuits wheel Loc's covered body out causing Haines to lose it completely. TWO DOCTORS in Spacesuits try to subdue him in his open bed.  He trashes yanking at his I.V.'s.
Get this shit offa me -- Hoskins aims a tranquilizer gun and shoots him with a tranq dart.
Loc's covered body is slid into the rack beside Deke's body bag.  The second death.  The submarine door closes.
Jaxx enters.  She strokes her daughter with her hands in the glove ports.  Jamie squeezes them through the plastic
I'm here, Jamie.  I'm here.
Where's Dad... and Jason?

Dad's with Jason and Popsy and Mama just down the hall.  They're having their blood tested.  We're going to take some of yours too.  Check it out.  You might not be sick at all. Jamie smiles faintly.  Maj. Hoskins ties off Jamie's arm through the glove ports and thumps up a vein.
Mom... this is the "slammer" isn't it?  I heard you talk about it. Jaxx nods.  She can't stand to see Jamie suffer.  She holds Jamie's hand -- the needle enters her arm.  Jamie cries out.
Full winter moon.  The AIT's have pitched camp around the Copter.  The Pilot works on the engine under generator lights.  Bullet hits are visible across the cockpit glass
(on radio)
C'mon, C.J., I don't want Rangers and State Police up here guns blazing.  I need this guy alive. Reese listens intently trying to stay warm.
(on radio)
He's no good to us with a bullet in his head.  We'll never know if his antibodies can beat the bug or not. Okay -- tell them he's contagious. That'll buy some time. (a response on radio)
Yeah, I should've brought my fishing tackle.  How's Nancy's kid.  Any word -- ?
It glows with Ebola antigen response.
Jaxx sits back from the microscope, trembling.  She sags, dropping her head on the bench.  She weeps openly.
Pete's face tells us this is a horrible way to go.  Jaxx looks on with loving eyes.  She feels helpless.
Lousy room service.  And what happened to the sexy nurses we used to have around here -- Jaxx strikes a pose.  His laugh is like sandpaper.  He's dying and knows it.
Listen to me.  I want you to give the rest of my old friend to Jamie. She's young.  The antibodies might turn her around. Jaxx doesn't know what to say.  She can barely speak.

Hey, maybe I'm the "magic bullet," Nance.  Go on, take it.  Give Jamie a fighting chance.  I got work to do in the lab, anyway -- He unplugs his I.V. from the precious serum and sits up - Nancy has to subdue him.  Maj. Hoskins hurries in to help
Jamie.  Her face a mask.  Comatose.  Gerry checks her temperature.  Jaxx enters.  She's been crying.
(back to Jaxx)

No break in her fever.  Ribovirin's not working.  Efficacy is zero... Her fever's still up.  We need immuno serum, Nance.  None of the patients are responding... Jaxx regards their daughter.  She makes herself do it.
Peter wants her to have this. She unhooks the antiviral I.V. bag and replaces it with a serum bag marked "Sister G."
(dumbfounded)
Peter's better?  His fever broke? Jaxx shakes her head slowly.  Gerry reacts, overcome.  He holds Nancy close, both gazing at their daughter.  Small hemorrhages mar her youthful face.
What's Jamie's --
One-o-three.  Just checked it.
Take it every thirty minutes.  If there's any drop, I don't care how slight, we'll know the serum's working.  She'll pull out.  She will.
Karl sits hunched by river fire drinking coffee.  Everyon else still sleeps.  He's fixed on the campfire.
The sounds of Africa haunts him.  Drums pound relentlessl -- He looks up, suddenly startled.

A beautiful AFRICAN WOMAN walks out of the bush.  She kneels across the fire from him. She hands Karl a gourd brimming with healing waters.  He reaches for it -- FLAMES SINGE HIS FINGERS. He jerks back, looking around, disoriented.
The river.  Sun coming up.  Reese is staring at him.
Karl?  Are you alright, Karl?
(rattled)
Yeah, I'm alright.
The AIT's put in the raft, holding it steady in the backwater.  Karl and Reese board. Onshore, the Pilot holds up his 9mm pistol.  An offer.
I don't believe in guns as an equalizer.  Nature's full of equalizers more deadly... They shove off.  The AIT Leader in front, Reese in the middle and Karl at the stern.
Karl steers them into the rapids.  They move swiftly downriver.
Watching high cliffs and dense woods slide by.
Karl crossing on the raft.  Zairean Police aiming guns.
His fingers sinking into a dead man's arm like pudding. Village children singing to the Nuns. Sister Genevieve convulsing in his arms.
He shivers, near convulsing.  Another river to cross.
Another body bag slides in beside six other bodies.  The tag reads:  MAJ. ARNOLD HAINES.
A TV MONITOR:  The Local ANCHORWOMAN standing outside RII interviews C.J. by phone inside.  He's running on fumes. The Staff watches him and the monitor.
How many deaths so far, Colonel?
We can confirm seven as a direct result of the virus -- including employees at the primate facility... and one of our own.
Corridor beds are now filled.  30 PATIENTS are tended by MEDICAL STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS wearing Scrubs, masks, decon suits, anything to protect against possible infection.

We're continuing to bring all "cases" and exposed persons here to RIID.  We'll try to contain the virus here until it burns itself out -- We're still trying to find a rescue therapy that's effective against the virus -- AIT's wheel in Girard in an isolator.  He's almost gone.
Peter's Wife sleeps on a sofa with her two children. Others rest on chairs or the floor. Jaxx checks a patient who looks good.  Eyes clear. Minimal symptoms.  It's the Big Black Woman from Synergy.
(to nurse)
Check her blood again.  Maybe she has the "magic bullet" antibodies. The Black Woman smiles hopeful.  Jaxx looks past her out the glass partition into the Slammer area.
A Medic covers up another victim. Jaxx thinks that could easily be Jamie... Gerry hurries up.  Jaxx instantly panics --
Her temperature's down.  One-o-one. Jaxx.  Her panic rockets to joy -- Gerry half carries her down the hall -- both euphoric.
The last of Sister "G" plasma drips into Jamie's I.V. Jaxx reaches in the glove ports and wipes a trace of bloo from Jamie's ear.
She's responding.  It's working. Human immuno serum protocol works.
And we're fresh out -- Goddamn bug! Gerry folds her into him.  They share a frustrated cry --
Why can't I just put my life in her I.V.  Why...? They hold each other tight, praying for a miracle.  Gerry ceremoniously pulls a stuffed bear from a bag of personals.

Nancy... when she was two years old -- but she used to want "Dee Dah" the Bear when she was sick. Jaxx kisses the bear and tucks it in beside Jamie.  Jamie instinctively hugs it to her.  She wakes staring at them.

Mom... I'm sorry I said bad things about guinea pigs -- and mice.  I know you're just trying to make me well -- Jamie drifts off.  Jaxx wells up.  She suddenly heads awa -- filled with Jamie's words.  Gerry follows --

The animals -- Pete's working on synthetic antibodies -- He's growing living immune animal cells and living human cells together -- to clone a super immune cell.  So far guinea pig cells don't work.  I just had an idea -- that might --
Gerry catches her as they exit.
We can mass produce antibody serum for any bug.  It would be just like having Sister Genevieve alive again -- donating her blood.  There's a way --
Nancy -- that's all theory.  Lab trials.  Nothing solid.  It could take months to get results. Gerry holds her trying to calm her down.  She fights him.

This is not just about our Jamie anymore.  If we -- can't save her, if we lose her, think about the lives we can save in a month or a year -- Jaxx is choking back her tears, knowing what she's saying but keeping her duty to humanity always above all.
You'll do the right thing by Jamie. You always do the right thing. She breaks.  The airlock door hisses closed behind her. She hesitates at the port -- then disappears.
One last question, Col. Peters; Is the the virus airborne?
Tiny's cabin comes into view on the bluff.  It's snowing lightly.  The Raft.  Karl motions.  They turn into the bank.  Reese jumps out pulling them ashore.
Each Man shoulders a pack of medical gear.  They begin th ascent up a steep trail.  The AIT Leader talks softly on his radio as they climb --
(on radio)
Bird dog -- we made dry land.
Police are enroute on fire road. ETA forty-five minutes.  Half-it for their Rescue Chopper -- over.
Reese pulls himself up over the bluff rim.
In his face.  Fangs bared.  Reese flails back -- pulling Karl with him. KARL GRABS REESE'S HAND -- stopping each other's fall.
It's been dead for hours.  Wedged in the rocks.  Reese checks it for wounds.
No bullet entries.  No arrow wounds. Karl wipes the blood caked around its nose on a swab, the from its mouth.  He seals it in a baggie.
Maybe the virus just jumped species... again.
The AIT LEADER climbs up beside them eyeing the dead animal.  Each grabs a respirator off his utility belt and slips it on.
No movement.  The Team chuck their equipment in the trees
Hello! Nothing.  He raises his respirator.
Hello!  Mr. Whippert!  I'm a Doctor. Do you need medical attention?! No response.
Maybe he's gone... or dead... Karl stands to approach the house.  Reese pulls him back. TINY FIRES wildly from the window raking the trees -- -- FILLETING the ground all around them --
Rounds rip the rocks.  Karl looks at Reese and grins.
He's alive.  That's a good sign. Reese looks at him like he's nuts.
You are certifiable --
(peeking at the house)
We'll see.  Shuck me a syringe. Load it with a 100cc's of "ketamine." Another look from Reese as he opens his pack --
You're going to anesthetize him?
Sounds good to me.  Just got to get close enough. Reese looks at the AIT Leader.  Now he knows Karl's crazy
Doc, we should wait for the Cops.
He crawls along the rocks talking a bluestreak.
Mr. Whippert!  We have medicine -- and a helicopter that can fly you to a hospital. (no response)
How long have you been sick?  You know -- when did you get your first headache?  Fever -- ?
No answer.  Reese tosses Karl a pack of two syringes. Karl signals to the AIT to split up making tough targets.
Tiny fires wildly.
The ground fillets around him.  A round rips into his leg He goes down screaming. JOHNSON DIVES behind a stack of firewood as bullets chew up the pile --
Silence... Reese makes his way to the wounded man.
No, no, no, no, no!  The Police are coming and if you start shooting you'll be dead.  I don't want you to die right now.  I want you to get well... (a beat)
Now -- how long have you been sick?
More'n a week... I think -- Can't 'member anymore -- Sorry... His voice is weak.  Strained.  Karl crawls toward the Van.
Good.  Maybe you're getting better. Let me come in.  Check you out.

No fuckin' way!  If the heat come, I'll shoot'em too. He fires wildly from the window.  Then clicks no ammo. TO REESE:  Dressing the AIT Leader's leg wound. TO JOHNSON:  Reaching the van.  The passenger door is open.  Karl checks it out.  Keys?  Yes.
I know how you feel, Tiny.  I can help you.  Walk out now, while there's still time.
Tiny answers with more gunfire.  Karl turns on the engine the car radio and releases the emergency brake.  Country and Western blares.
KARL RUNS behind it using it for cover -- TINY RAKES the front of the Van.  A wheel hits a rock jolting it off line -- The Van rolls past the cabin -- KARL DIVES on the porch rolling to safety --

head_text.subj: THE VAN RUNS RIGHT OFF THE BLUFF

text: Crashing into the River below in a fiery explosion --
The AIT's go into action.  They're not waiting any longer Helicopter engine whines up --
Reese can't see Karl anywhere from his vantage point. Tiny is yelling inside, demented, delirious.

Karl edges toward the back door, he primes his syringe, pumping himself up for the charge. A BALL OF FLAME ERUPTS inside.  Gasoline EXPLODES. FLAMES BILLOW out the windows. KARL reels back from the blast. REESE covers the AIT Leader.
The rage builds in him erupting in a primal scream.  He rushes headlong crashing through the back door --

We're in the cabin.  Flames swirl about Tiny.  He's weak -- leaning against a post, gun dangling in his hand.  He turns to us.  His face hideous in the flames.  His clothe catch fire.  He hurls a flaming gas can right at us -- KARL CHARGES tackling the big man sending them crashing -
The two Men crash to the ground.
Karl pounds out the flames on Tiny's body.

Don't you die on me!  Don't you dare!  Live Goddamnit.  I need a survivor -- damn you -- live! He dumps his respirator -- he desperately checks the big man's vital signs.  Reese runs up with the medical bag. THE HUEY SWOOPS UP over the bluff and lands.  AIT's jump out bringing more gear and the isolator. Two AIT's spray fire extinguishers on the burning cabin.
Tiny is not responding to CPR.  Karl pumps air into his mouth.  Nothing. Karl rips open his shirt -- his body is covered with hemorrhages and skin ruptures.

You're not dying on me, Tiny.  C'mon you son-of-a-bitch -- Reese hands him a big needle.  He shoots the adrenalin right in Tiny's heart.  Nothing.  He pounds the man's chest.  Reese pulls him back pinning him.
He's gone.  He's dead... Karl, angry at himself and the world, holds it all in.  H closes Tiny's eyes.
Hey!  Over here -- Reese looks up, stunned by what he sees.  He grabs Karl.
A GIRL walks out of the flaming smoldering Cabin.  Tiny's white trash girlfriend from the Roadhouse.  She's dazed, suffering from smoke inhalation, alive.  A survivor.
Now that is a genuine miracle. Karl approaches her.  She reaches out both hands and collapses.  He catches her laying her down.

head_text.subj: THE POLICE HELICOPTER ARRIVES HOVERING OVERHEAD

text: This is the Virginia State Police. Clear the burning area -- Karl pays no attention checking the girl's vitals.  More Police and Rangers arrive up the fire road in the b.g.
Rangers join the effort to put out the fire.  AIT's meet the Police keeping them away from potential contagion.
Reese gives her oxygen.  Karl injects her with antivirals He checks her arms and neck for hemorrhages.  No petechiae.
No symptoms.  Maybe she's incubating. He finds a small patch of symptomatic rash on her back.
She's got the bug.
Yeah, so?  For how long?  A week?  A day?  What's her temperature?
(shocked)
Ninety-nine.  She's almost normal. She should be roasting if he infected her in the last week.
(incredulous)
Unless... she's a survivor. Unless... she's immune. Karl looks at the girl.  Traumatized but her pulse is normal.
We have to get her back to RIID. Now!  Move!
The Huey lifts off leaving the Police and Rangers below dousing the fire.
Tiny's body bag lays on the floor.  Reese draws blood fro the Girl in the isolator.  She is delirious.
Tim?  Where's Tim?  Have to take care of him.  He's so sick --
(floored, realizing)
She was no hostage.  She liked the poor guy. Karl clamps a field centrifuge onto a seat back and begin cranking.  The blood sacks spin --
They fly straight into the morning sun.
Another corpse slides in the rack.  It's Girard.  There i no more room for bodies.
Jamie.  Her arm covered with petechiae.  The rest of her body is under the sheets.  We don't want to see it.
Jaxx, dark circles under her eyes, exhausted, studies a cell culture in the monitor attached to her microscope.
Grow.  C'mon -- grow.  Maybe the CDR grafting didn't take. She turns to another monitor showing a complicated cell structure turning in 3D graphics.  The heading reads:
She rotates the diagram with key commands.  She looks up. Someone enters the lab in a spacesuit.  The figure moves closer.  It's Peter.  Weak and frail, but he's there.
Pete -- what are you doing -- ?
Hey, I'm beating this thing, okay.  I feel good -- He does a wobbly James Brown in his spacesuit.  Jaxx is blown away he's even walking.
The irony of it all.  I wore this thing for years to keep the bugs out.  Now I'm wearing it to keep them in.
Pete?  Your fever broke?

Fever?  What fever?  Hey?  You trying to take credit for my work? "Synthetic generation of human antibodies by combination with super immune animal cells" by Peter Jahrling... Jaxx eyes him suspiciously.  He studies the monitor.
I've been grafting high immunity guinea pig cells to human myeloma cells, but the fusion hybridoma immortalizes only a few B cells. Low antibody production.  Useless against a mother-bug like Ebola.
I used Supermonk's IG genes.
I'm impressed.  Better gene match with humans.
The immunoglobulins won't clone. It's not working.

Here's your problem.  Change the binding site.  Splice the genes here and hope it grows up to be the Holy Grail. Peter makes some adjustments to the computer generated cell diagram. Jaxx looks at the screen in awe.  The two cells form one super immune cell.  (Computer graphic).
You're a genius, Pete.  Let's get you back to the slammer. He resists her, hugging the stool, barely able to focus.
No, I have to finish this.  If the human cells you're using are strong and healthy, this just might work. Whose are they?
Mine. Peter looks at her through his helmet, he smiles --

Well, I'd say if your daughter has any of the stuff her mother's made of -- her children and her grandchildren will be born immune -- Jaxx wells up at the hope he's given her.  Hope.  A final tear of blood trickles from his eye.
C'mon -- let's get you back to... the... slammer... Pete?  Pete! No answer.  Pete lumps over in his bluesuit -- and dies.
Armed Soldiers in gas masks surround the RIID building. Bradley Tanks block the roads in and out at Checkpoints. Media trucks line the parking lot.
An estimated 47 exposed persons are being housed inside the RIID fortress, which is now completely quarantined and cut off from the outside world except by telephone.

11 deaths have now been reported since the outbreak began three days ago.  This tent ward behind me is for overflow cases the CDC and the U.S. Medical Corps hope never come. The Anchor walks us through the hospital tent that has been erected on the parade grounds.  ARMY MEDICAL CORPS MEN AND WOMEN are setting up rows of field cots. The THUD of a helicopter approaches.  Everyone looks up.
The Huey lands beside the building.  The AIT's hurry the stretcher bearing the Girl toward the wall hatch.
Toward the guarded main entrance carrying blood vials and dangling the makeshift plasma bags on a coat hanger. Soldiers challenge.
Sir, no one is allowed in without authorization --
There are people dying in there, I'm going to try and save them. He never breaks stride; the same phrase he said to the soldiers in Zaire. C.J. opens the door waving them in --
Let'em in.  C'mon.  What the hell have you been doing -- fishing?
WE FOLLOW THEM through the maze of beds and patients lining the corridors.  Karl carries the bags of serum lik the Holy Grail.  Doctors look up.  Staff step aside.
Karl enters the Slammer Airlock and barrels past Maj. Hoskins -- Reese hangs back with C.J. WE FOLLOW KARL through the chem shower into --
Hovering, waiting to take her next.  Both parents hold he hands through the glove ports. They are strangely not surprised to see Karl.  He stops short at the sight of Jamie.
We're losing her, Karl. He shoves the plasma bags at Gerry.

Put her on this.  Tiny bought the farm.  This is from his girlfriend. Reese spun the plasma phoresis in the chopper -- Check it for antibodies.  I think she's immune. I think she's the "magic bullet." They look at each other -- vaporlock.  Gerry grabs the bags.
I'll screen it.  Just don't let Jamie die. He runs out shouting for C.J.  Karl hovers over Jamie -- hoping he's not too late.
(finding her voice)
Pete had a breakthrough.  He did it. We can crank out Ebola immune cell antibodies in a few weeks -- Jaxx is all nerve endings watching Jamie.
That's not fast enough.  Let's get Pete on this new plasma too. He can tell by her reaction, Pete's dead.  He bows his head saying a silent goodbye.  Then grabs Jaxx --
Karl drags Jaxx into the last room --
It's the only chance Jamie or any of us have got.  Meet the donor. Maj. Hoskins tends the Girl.  She's sitting up in the isolator, completely alert -- a thermometer in her mouth. She glares at Karl.
Her temperature is normal, Doctor. Pulse stable.
Hey, where's Tim?  What is this place?  Anybody got a cigarette? Karl shakes his head no.  Jaxx checks her chart in shock.
What's your name?
"Angel." Jaxx looks to Karl.  What else --
C.J. is on a phone hookup to CNN.  TV's show all networks
(on phone)
If we hold out another 24 hours with no new cases, then our strategy to contain the outbreak has promise. We hope to have a synthetic antibody serum with strong efficacy in a few days.

We all recognize the enormous risk CDC and Military personnel are taking by being in that building. Colonel -- will all the viruses and exposed patients inside with you, is there a danger of a virus escaping and infecting the entire community?
(on phone)
Only if it walks out in one of us.
Karl takes her blood pressure.  Blood oozes around the arm-strap.
I don't want Jason to see her like this -- Gerry burst in --
She's clean.  No "hep."  HIV's negative.  And -- she's loaded with antibodies!
(continuing the thought)
But -- "Angel" has minimal symptoms --
(finishing it)
-- then Karl's right.  She must be immune. The whole slammer is buzzing.  Gerry looks to Jaxx for a decision.  Jaxx hooks the desperation plasma up herself.
Jaxx gets right beside Jamie as close as the plastic will allow.  She whispers, determined not to give up.

You listen to me Jamie Magritte Jaxx, God gave you an immune system to fight disease with -- so fight. Don't think about anything else but living.  You want to do a triple twist -- live, Jamie, live.  You want to go to the Olympics don't you? She strokes Jamie's face through the glove port.  Gerry i right beside her.  Karl leans into view on the other side
Kick this bug in the ass.  Never, never, never, never give up -- If you live, your blood can save another and another.
It's a privilege we've forgotten as humans, Jamie.  We can save each other.

head_text.subj: WE PUSH IN TIGHT ON THE PLASMA BAG

text: Hoskins, Medical Staff, Jaxx, Johnson, Gerry all pitching in to hook up other ailing patients to the serum.  Faces we have seen; the Black Woman from Synergy, Loc's Vietnamese Wife.  Everyone pitches in. Jason pushes a cart of I.V.'s.  Gayle, Pete's grieving Wife shows up beside Jaxx.  She wants to help.  Klages an Godwin are there with C.J. --
All bear her one word name; "ANGEL."  Each bubbling life.

As one by one, the Team enters the Slammer through the airlock, exhausted, shedding tears, hopeful, holding onto each other -- all connected as they embrace Jaxx and Gerr and encircle Jamie in the isolator -- willing her to live
Feverish, staring into nothing.  Suddenly her eyes focus. A heavenly smile crosses her face.  She takes her parent' hands squeezing them tight --

head_text.subj: A WATERFALL CRASHES ONTO ROCKS BELOW

text: It's Spring.  Karl and Jaxx sit on the bank reflecting. Jaxx -- her head buried on her knees.  We can't tell what shape she's in.  Karl gives her a convalescent squeeze.
On a day like this, we can pretend nature is benign -- and all the monsters and beasts in nature have their kinder moments. Jaxx looks up.  Quietly crying.
I didn't think it'd be this hard.
(wiping her tears)
You have to get over it.  The wheel of life goes on, Nance.
I just see her lying there.  I don't know how I'll ever be able to -- to thank you and not start crying -- He laughs.  Now we here more laughter coming from the river.  Then a familiar voice --
Mom -- look, Mom -- wahooo!

There in the middle of the beautiful Big Horn is Beautifu Jamie, full of life and joy.  She's caught a Rainbow trou and is reeling it in.  She's alive. Gerry fishes with her.  Jason wades upstream to net it.
Whoa -- must be a record catch --
-- for a "fisher-babe"! Brother and Sister again.  And Dad trying to moderate.
(musing sadly)
I wish Peter was here to share this.
Without his discovery, and Angel's precious blood.  We might not be here either.  Her synthesized antibodies saved a lot of lives.  He died a hero.  You should share a little credit too -- Colonel.
Naw -- Pete lived long enough to show me the way.  It's his legacy. Jaxx lays back taking in the beauty around them.
Gerry helps Jamie set the fish free.
Are we ready for the next one?
We weren't ready for this one.  This was a wakeup call.  We're just one international plane flight away from extinction. Jaxx sits up on that one staring at him.  What?

Sure.  Say a tourist gets an unknown airborne virus in an African village in the morning, flies home that day, smoking, coughing -- sneezing. Aerosol droplets get circulated by the air vents -- so by the time you land, everyone onboard's been exposed.  Passengers walk through customs right back home exposing families, cabbies, friends.  Over night thousands are exposed.  Then the outbreak.  Slate wiper... Silence.  The sounds of nature abound.  Jaxx is riveted.
(inevitable)
Pretty soon us two-legged dinosaurs are history.
Mother nature's revenge... God, I'll never fly again... Why not go back to Africa and find the viruses before they find us, huh?
I never should have left.
You better teach me to fish quick, because that's where you're going. Jaxx jumps up, brushing herself off.  Karl gets up --
What're you talking about?

You raised so much hell, the CDC and the Army are joint funding a new research lab in the bush to find the reservoirs for Ebola, Marburg, AIDS, new bugs -- maybe some ancestors of some lost tribe I seem to recall you mentioning. She marches into the river with her fly rod.
(calling back)
That is -- if you're interested. Karl is speechless for the first time in his life.  He grabs his favorite fishing hat -- rod -- big shiny grin - and follows her into the river.
This is how we leave them.  The Jaxx family and Karl Johnson fishing the Big Horn --
Teeming with biological life, gleaming in the sun, threading like spaghetti through a geography of terrains. Like the cellscape we opened our story on -- we finish on -- Watching the river run...

1.  To date the origin or reservoir of the Ebola virus is still unknown; there is still no vaccine for Ebola and no proven cure. 2.  The CDC levied fines against Synergy and three other primate companies and banned the shipment of monkeys into the United States for 18 months. 3.  No virus was found at the JFK animal unit where the monkeys entered the U.S.  The Philippine exporter would not allow a CDC/Army Team to inspect their animal quarantine unit. 4.  Monkeys with the Ebola virus were reported in primate quarantine units in Texas and Pennsylvania during the Reston outbreak. 5.  Nancy and Gerry Jaxx are both acting Colonels of Veterinary Medicine at USAMRIID and are actively involved in vaccine and viral research... including Ebola. 6.  Peter Jahrling is alive and well and Head of Virology at USAMRIID.  He continues his research on synthetic antibodies and is currently in South America isolating a new virus. 7.  C.J. Peters is now head of Special Pathogens at CDC i Atlanta.  He is currently in command of the CDC's efforts to control the spread of the Hantavirus outbreak in this country. 8.  Karl Johnson lives in Montana with his wife Merle nea the Gallatin River.  Karl isolated the Ebola virus in 1976, and the Hantavirus the same year.  If he isn't fishing, then Karl is currently consulting with C.J. Peters and the CDC on the Hantavirus outbreak in the U.S. that is still talking human lives as of this writing.
